definition: skin-deep/superficial/shallow
to float/superficial/floating/unstable/movable/provisional/temporary/transient/impetuous/hollow/inflated/to exceed/superfluous/excessive/surplus
shallow/light (color)
sound of moving water

sentences.english: In the hall, the shallow challenger shall be allowed to swallow the swallows.
sentences.chinese: 在大廳裏，浮淺得挑釁者將被容許吞下燕子。

sentences.english: The respirations are rapid, shallow and grunting, counting 40 a minute.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸快，浮淺，並且發出咕嚕聲，一分鐘有40次。

sentences.english: His understanding of his mistake is rather superficial.
sentences.chinese: 他對錯誤的認識比較浮淺。

sentences.english: I heard that Green Island has good snorkeling.
sentences.chinese: 我聽說在綠島浮淺很不錯。

sentences.english: I already began to feel that much of what the world was seeking was superficial.
sentences.chinese: 我開始覺得很多世間所追尋的東西是很浮淺的。

sentences.english: shallow men believe in luck. self-trust is the first secret of success.
sentences.chinese: 浮淺的人相信運氣，而成功的第一祕訣是自信。

definition: lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to miss/to yearn day and night
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
to play deaf-mute
to have no cares/to be carefree
sighing voice, wailing breath (idiom)/to heave deep sighs/to sigh in despair
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
unfair treatment/injustice
lit. to use the eastern wind (idiom)/fig. to use sb's help
isolated/solitary
